arxivCategories.title: ArXiv Categories
arxivCategories.description: Configure which ArXiv categories to fetch papers from. These categories apply globally to all topics.
arxivCategories.noCategoriesSelected: No categories selected. Add categories below or select from common AI categories.
arxivCategories.customCategoryHelp: Enter ArXiv category identifiers (e.g., cs.AI for AI, cs.LG for Machine Learning)

infoBox.title: About ArXiv Categories
infoBox.description: Papers will be fetched from all selected categories. You can mix categories from different fields (e.g., cs.AI for AI, stat.ML for statistical ML). Find more categories at

deepAnalysis.title: Deep Analysis Mode
deepAnalysis.description: Choose how deeply you want to analyze papers that pass the relevance filter

standard.name: Standard Mode
standard.title: Standard Mode
standard.bestForDesc: Quick but thorough analysis. Good for most use cases. Falls back to abstract if LaTeX unavailable.

full.name: Full Mode
full.title: Full Mode
full.bestForDesc: Deep research and implementation. Requires LaTeX download. Higher API costs and slower processing.

deepAnalysis.recommendation: Recommendation: Start with Standard Mode for efficient analysis. Switch to Full Mode only when you need deep technical insights for implementation work.

asyncAnalysis.title: Async Analysis Mode
asyncAnalysis.description: Configure concurrent LLM analysis to speed up paper processing. Use higher concurrency for faster results, but be aware of API rate limits.
asyncAnalysis.syncModeDesc: Process papers one at a time. Safer for API rate limits, but slower.
asyncAnalysis.asyncModeDesc: Process multiple papers simultaneously. Much faster, but may hit rate limits.
asyncAnalysis.concurrencyWarning: Note: Higher concurrency may hit API rate limits. Start with 1-2 and increase gradually.

llmRetry.title: LLM API Retry Settings
llmRetry.description: Configure how the app handles failed LLM API calls with automatic retries
llmRetry.maxRetryDurationHelp: Maximum total time for all retries (seconds)
llmRetry.jitterFactorHelp: Random variation to prevent thundering herd
llmRetry.retryOnRateLimitHelp: Retry when API rate limit is exceeded
llmRetry.retryOnNetworkErrorHelp: Retry on connection failures and timeouts
llmRetry.note: Note: Authentication errors (401) and bad requests (400) will never be retried as they indicate permanent issues.

schedule.title: Scheduled Fetch
schedule.description: Automatically fetch and analyze papers on a schedule
schedule.runFetchNowDesc: Manually trigger a paper fetch immediately
schedule.dailyDesc: Fetch every day at specified time
schedule.fetchTimeHint: Papers will be fetched automatically at {{time}} every day
schedule.enableAutoFetchHint: Enable auto-fetch to automatically fetch and analyze papers on a schedule. You'll be notified when new papers are available.

errors.selectAtLeastOneDay: Please select at least one day of the week

storage.title: Storage Settings
storage.description: Configure where paper files are stored
storage.savedDescription: Your storage preferences have been updated.

latex.title: LaTeX Download Directory
latex.infoDesc: When a paper's relevance score meets or exceeds the Deep Analysis Threshold, the full LaTeX source will be automatically downloaded for comprehensive analysis including algorithms, formulas, and charts.
latex.defaultPathDesc: Using default path. LaTeX sources will be automatically downloaded when papers meet the Deep Analysis Threshold.
latex.customPathDesc: LaTeX sources will be downloaded to this directory when papers meet the Deep Analysis Threshold.
latex.statusEnabled: LaTeX download is enabled by default

pdf.title: PDF Download Directory
pdf.infoDesc: Configure where PDF files are stored for in-app viewing. PDFs are downloaded on-demand when you click 'Open PDF' in paper details.
pdf.defaultPathDesc: Using default path. PDFs will be downloaded to ~/Documents/PaperFuse/pdfs
pdf.customPathDesc: PDFs will be downloaded to this directory when you open them in the viewer.

cache.title: Relevance Cache
cache.infoDesc: Stores paper relevance analysis results to avoid redundant LLM API calls. Clear this cache if you change your research interests or topics configuration.

fetchHistory.title: Fetch History
fetchHistory.description: View the history of paper fetch operations

analysis.title: Analysis Configuration
analysis.description: Customize which analysis modules are enabled for paper analysis
analysis.globalModeDescription: Choose the default analysis mode. Standard uses abstract + intro/conclusion. Full analyzes the complete paper (excluding appendices, references).
analysis.savedDescription: Your analysis preferences have been updated.

ai_summary.name: AI Summary
ai_summary.description: Concise 2-3 sentence summary of the paper's core contributions

topics.name: Topic Classification
topics.description: Classify paper into research topics and suggest relevant tags

key_insights.name: Key Insights
key_insights.description: Extract 5-7 key insights or contributions from the paper

quality_assessment.name: Quality Assessment
quality_assessment.description: Rate novelty (0-10), effectiveness (0-10), and experiment completeness (0-10)

code_links.name: Code Links
code_links.description: Extract GitHub links and code references from the paper

engineering_notes.name: Engineering Notes
engineering_notes.description: Detailed engineering insights: target projects, integration approach, challenges, production concerns

related_papers.name: Related Papers
related_papers.description: Identify papers that build on, improve, or relate to this work

algorithms.name: Algorithms
algorithms.description: Extract key algorithms with names, complexity, and step-by-step descriptions

complexity.name: Complexity Analysis
complexity.description: Analyze time complexity and space complexity with big-O notation

flowchart.name: Algorithm Flowchart
flowchart.description: Generate Mermaid flowchart code showing the algorithm's workflow

formulas.name: Key Formulas
formulas.description: Extract important mathematical formulas with LaTeX notation and descriptions

analysis.infoText: Changes to analysis configuration will apply to newly analyzed papers. Existing papers will not be affected.
